name: Infestation: The New Z
description: The New Z is a FREE TO PLAY multi-game mode experience. Play BATTLE ROYALE and be the last man standing to win. SURVIVE with friends and gather loot, stash and trade. Go into wars against other groups in a massive OPEN WORLD. Three different separate game modes ALL IN ONE GAME.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 7 - SP1 64bit Processor: AMD® A8 3870 3,6 Ghz or Intel® Core ™ i3 2100 3.1Ghz or better Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA® GeForce GTX 465 / ATI Radeon TM HD 6870 DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 10 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9 Compatible Card
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 10 - SP1 64bit Processor: AMD® FX 8150 3.6 GHz or Intel® Core™ i7 2600 3.4 GHz or better Memory: 6 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA® GeForce® GTX 950, ATI Radeon™ R7 360 or better DirectX: Version 9.0 Network: Broadband Internet connection Storage: 15 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9 Compatible Card

reviews.review_text: There are a lot of negative reviews on this game, so I just wanted to share my perspective being a long time War Z veteran. This is really not a bad game.... I would say that most of the reviews are negative because of the players who have never touched a WarZ game in their life, and expect to dominate in the PvP aspect of things. There's definitely a learning curve involved, but if you're willing to make an effort to learn the mechanics of the game, you'll be fine. Also, WarZ has always had a more arcade like feel, rather than a realistic one. If you don't like that, try a game like Day Z, or Miscreated. Devs seem for the most part active and involved, and are good at communicating with their community, unlike the devs of I:SS. From what I can gather, they seem to care about a lot more than just their pocketbooks. Another thing I was very concerned about was this being a free to play title, with in game purchases leading to pay-2-win tactics. However, I found that this is NOT the case when it comes to this game. Anyone playing for free can be JUST as competitive with a premium player. All in all, I think it's a decent game, and DEFINITELY an upgrade from I:SS Classic. Plus, it's free, and who doesn't like free?

*I have never heard of the New Z before it coming out on steam and tried it out for the first time yesterday*    First off I want to say this game is free. Meaning there should be no reason for you to listen to reviews. You should play it and see if you like it or not.    For a free game it's actually alright. There are no pay to win elements what so ever except being able to buy premium which is like unturned premium, yes you can buy meds and ammo for real life money, but you can also do so with ingame money which is easy to get. In my 3 hours I have well over 150 grand which is more than 20+ dollars can buy.  This game is mainly pvp, with meds that have cool downs to use during fight, barricades to block off bullets, and a sweet arcade feel for combat that is not realistic at all.  Killing zombies is quite rewarding as well and there is a skill gap in this game. You can find clans that go in together and run parts of the map on servers, so skilled gamers will enjoy this game.  Remember this isn't a survival game but a shooter with zombies, where you find loot like meds, armor, guns, etc. and then go to pvp. That's the whole game. But it is fun to play and free. All negative reviewers are ♥♥♥♥ing stupid or are rating this way to harshly.  Overall: 7/10 *Fun to play with friends every now and then and free*
The servers are a bit unstable. otherwise its easy to gear up and pvp, if you used to play WarZ/ISS i reccomend, if not, do not play.
I nominate this game for game of the decade.

This game is a good free to play alternative to the mainstrem survival horror titles (Dayz, H1, Forest) However this title lacks teh depth of the aforementioned and is more comparable to the likes of Unturned. The lack of depth results in players becoming fully equiped quickly and having no further goals as the game lacks Base building and a crafting system.  Additionally the freemium which this game has adopted could be a turn off for consumers as it does result in many fustrating barriers to entry for free player such as having to wait to be revived after death. It also results in some elements that could be considered pay to win by some however it is mitigated by allowing free players to earn store credit through gameplay which can purchase MOST of the same items.  This game provides a slighty more immersive experience than that of unturned however lacks many of the crafting and base building mechanics which is expected by a game in this genre, however it is still a good survival horror game given its development history and ease of access.

Please don't listen to most of these reviews, they're just mad players from previous WarZ iterations coming back to bash a perfectly good game.  So here's my honest, UNBIASED review.  Pros: -Looks pretty decent. -Well optimized, I get a solid 4K60fps with a GTX 690 -No pay to win -Free -HUGE worlds -Lots of gun and melee weapons -Can be VERY intense  Cons: -Player runs kinda slow. -When I'm in a car and going fast, the game will freeze for 0.5 seconds every 5 seconds or so. -Footstep sounds are sketchy as hell, they lag sometimes, making you think a player is near you. -Too many foreigners playing on NA servers. (Trust me, everyone in a server speaking spanish gets old.. FAST)   ^^ These are far from all the pros and cons, but they're all I can think of after having JUST woken up.   Overall, I'd rate this game a 7.5/10 I'd highly recommend everyone at least take a look at this game, ignoring all the bad reviews.

Let me start by saying i have had a strong love of this game since the original games release although that turned to ♥♥♥♥ rather quickly, and i have played a few of the different emulators. however many problems this game has its difficult for me to find a game similar to all the things us loyal fans love. The PVP just always feels so nice, along with just farming zombies and loot.  I think a big misconception everyone has of this is that it isnt a zombie survival game... it just isnt. people need to drill this out of their brain because it completely isnt, zombies are just existant along side a FULL PVP GAME with loot along side also.   Another big problem people have to complain about with the game is that 'oh i die super quick everytime by somone just after i spawn' the start is hard and tbh it has things you have to learn to pvp right. yes when you have no gear there is the little startup where you have to at least survive to the walk from the forest into a city to get guns. The struggle that follows this is fully geared people who might hang in the cities generally run with medkits/dx's along with riot shields to place giving them an advantage in a fight. then after that is skills that will make people more difficult to kill (health/less damage taken/better weapon stabilisation) but these are part of the grind that you get them from killing zombies.  The early game grind in this game isnt even nearly as bad as other versions of the game with weapons being so common and zombies giving a lot of GD so you can buy things like riot shields and meds if you dont find them yourself. so this complaining is irrelevant imo.  other than all of these yes the game has quite a few bugs which to some people might make them not like the game but i cannot deny that since the original release of the first warz the pvp and farming in this game has been SUPER satisfying to me and there is no PVP/Zombie/Looting game really that exists similar to this and if anything i enjoy the state of NewZ right now a lot better than the original intention of warz as the pvp and stacked gear looting is what i love about this game.  Love it.  👌

I love the game so far. But i see how it can get boring for some people. I'm gonna give some feedback so the devs know what to fix. Here goes:  - First off,the map is either too large / you're moving too slow / nothing's happening so that when you're on foot things can be kept interesting. Maybe make the character a bit faster / make the map a bit smaller. Also make it so that you can see randomly spawned resources on the roads while moving. And maybe add random spawn chance for drivable vehicles on the road. Just to keep things fresh,since there's a lot of complaints of the game just being 'Walk,get resources,die,repeat' and people get annoyed fast and just quit.  - Make the chance for guns spawning smaller. Make it higher for food, ammo and such. When i kill someone, most of the time they're carrying like 20 guns and almost no ammo cuz they dont know what they're doing. They barely have food and things I personally need so it doesnt make sense to kill others most of the time. Also remove some of the guns. Let's say, have 1 pistol, 3 rifles and 2 shotguns. Noone needs so much different ammo types. I say keep the FN Night Stalker Scar. That's one good rifle that'll be good if you keep it.  - Remove the new character starter items. I'm saying this cuz even i exploit this sometimes. When you use a character for a long time,you gather resources and store them in the global inventory. Then since you've got nothing on that character, you make another one and get food, a flashlight and some water. This CAN and WILL be exploited. Make it so that when you create a new character, you start off fresh, like the apocalypse just started. Yes it'll be harder for new players to make progress, but that's what the beginner servers are for,right?  - Make it so that players with over 1 hr playtime CAN'T join beginner servers,since judging by my last statement, if beginner servers are for new players to progress through the game, advanced players can just join and ruin the flow. Also, remove spawn chance for rare items on beginner servers so its also fair for new beginners to not get killed by advanced beginners,if you know what i mean (no pun intended). And kick the players out of beginner servers when they reach 1 hr playtime on a certain character, since you need 1 hr playtime to play on official servers. And if they didnt progress with their first character, they can just make a new one and play on a beginner server again and not do that mistake again.  That's all, i hope the devs read this and do these things cuz they swore they're different and listen to the community. I'll recommend this game and give it a positive review cuz i love it so far. Please listen to me if you're reading this Fredaikis. That's all, have fun!

Update: I just had my first 5-kill streak here, after following a squad of 3 players for about 20 minutes and about 5 minutes of firefight during which I also shot 2 random guys who came to the place of death of the first trio possibly due to shots having been fired.  This kind of adrenaline rush I only esperienced in the days of DayZ Mod. That was just great. And the amount of loot I was 'rewarded with' (took off the corpses eh) is insane. I hope I can log in tomorrow after work and bring it all to the camp site and stash it in my bank.  Gunplay is really great, something about it 'Just Works'(c), possibly a CS1.6 effect, meaning that the game mechanics are very simple, visual representation too and you're only left with the process happening before you eyes. It's definitely a cool game to spend some 20 mins per day with your friend, I have to bring my GF into this, should be fun.  JUST DON'T GIVE THESE DEVELOPERS YOUR HARD EARNED CASH. If they want it they must fix a lot of things and add more content aside from skins and loot boxes.  -----------------------------------End of UPD   The ground looks like some ♥♥♥♥ out of Vanilla WoW, no offense to Vanilla WoW.  But the game is already better than DayZ. It's actually fun to shoot. If they fix the graphics, add some real shaders, some fx on it, it can look good and play good.  Oh and also fix the spawns. Well, once I got in to the game after long load times a sniper killed me instantly after I spawned. After you die, you get removed from the server and have to wait 2 minutes before you respawn everytime you die and since it kicks you from the server you have to reload the entire game again. WOOHOO.. So much fun already. started another game and finally got some weapons. Sniper started shooting at me so I ran for the first building which had a small set of stairs to run up before entering. Got stuck on the first step, couldn't move, got sniped. lol.. I'm gonna go ahead and pass for now. Might try it a couple more times but it seemed like a mess first impressions.  Edit: Ok 7 hours later I have to say, I'm changing my thumbs down to a thumbs up. Yes it has it's problems but I found a lot of fun raiding towns getting in gun fights with other players, killing zombies and then getting the heck out of dodge and back to the safe zone to unload all my awesome gear in the storage. I really like the idea of the inventory storage feature. Don't like the pay to play stuff but it's not too bad. I like the open world mode. The stakes aren't really that high because it's fairly easy to find guns so getting sniped randomly doesn't ♥♥♥♥ you off as much because you can bounce back pretty fast. Once you start making some successful loot runs, then you can just load up your inventory with guns before starting again. I like it. Me and my girl just played for hours and plan on coming back for more. Fun game once you get the hang of it.

I played Infestation survivors stories 418 hours. I would say that they are the same game but F2P. Servers are crappy but if all goes to plan they are fixing that on dec 12. It is not pay to win like some people are saying, its more like csgo where you pay money to get skins (can't buy guns in the store). They do have a premium or a membership that gives you more XP and in-game money for killing zombies.  (In-Game) Servers are bad ATM but they are working on fixing that Dec 12. Ping can fluctuate between 60-1200 from server to server. Sometimes your game will crash (you can die from zombies if you dc in the wrong spot as well as players). This game is KOS or kill on sight if you're new to these kinds of game. I would say this is because a lot of people who played WarZ and Survivor stories are the main reason for this because they brought back the old way. There are a lot of guns so don't worry about not being able to protect yourself. I haven't seen a hacker yet so nothing to report there.   All in all, this is just a cheap F2P game so don't set your hopes too high

Ridicuously bad game. Don't even waste your time with the download.  Started from the moment I loaded it up--a pain in the ♥♥♥ to even set your controls. From there, after being harassed with spending money, trying to find a server to play on via the gameplay modes and navigating the server screens (plus, you can only sort by ping which is depicted as bars like a cellular signal) is quite cumbersome. They somehow managed to ♥♥♥♥ up the basic essentials to like every multiplayer game ever made.  Loading screen bar doesn't actually show loading progress at all. After joining, my ping on the lowest server (US) was 600-2500ms.. I couldn't find a server that dropped below 600ms and most times they were hanging in the ~1500 range and woud even spike to 4500. You can't see this number before actually joining the server, by the way.  It only gets worse from here. The high ping is obvious, even when picking up items/shooting zombies; essentially rendering the game uplayable. I kept going, though, in hopes of making something of the experience. You'll never be able to miss an item as they glow a bright blue. Mechanics of even the basic things like walking/strafing/springing/etc. are pretty bad and shooting guns feels like I'm playing with children's toys; extremely easy to aim and do a lot of damage, but god forbid you actually are able to hit another player that isn't stationary with the delay. People are spamming the global chat, players shoot on sight no matter what, and overall the community seems like a cest pool of inbred ♥♥♥♥tards.  The inventory system and overall mechanics of items is pretty horrid--an obvious ripoff that they somehow managed to make worse. And, aside from the foilage on trees, there wasn't anything particually worth looking at graphically speaking.  Going to just end the review here, really.. there's nothing about this game that warrants it wasting another second of my life.

Were you looking for an extremely rushed game with early 2000s style graphics that is basically another one of the thousand Arma/Rust style copies?! If so, you've come to the right place! This game will no more disappoint you than it will underwhelm you! In this gloriously low-poly third/first person shooter, you can wander aimlessly into a decently made terrain with very little thought put into it! Explore (or don't!) expansive forests with about 20 trees, complete with a glorious 2D look! Be amazed at the rushed feel of the game as it tries to leech itself into your wallet! Be at awe of the fact that there is more to buy than there is to do in this game! If you were thinking about tossing your dollars into a fire or spending money on DLC for a game, think no more! This game expertly lets you do both in an environment you wont want to play in for more than 30 minutes! Marvel in this game right now, as it wont last long! Spend your money on DLC and buy the devs more programming tutorials and pizza  NOW!

Hackers are still rampent. Inventory is a joke. The game now separates to allow new players to actualy learn a bit of the game before PVP outright destroys them. (taking their loot) But other than that, 2 modes STILL unavailable. The EXP/leveling system is poorly managed, and there are too many guns, not enough Melee options.  Oh and if you don't like Microtransactions being pushed on you - don't look at any shops.   I am an original 'The War Z' backer. I had high hopes back in the forums for the game, but it has NEVER once come through with it's promises. The company 'OP Productions LLC' Should simply be sued and forced to pay US for the problems. oh wait, they were sued, back in 2013.  This game is a joke guys. It's not 'changed' at all. It has all the flaws with a new title. The game hasn't fixed any of the game breaking problems it had, nor updated graphics. Infestation: The New Z is an under-developed 'videogame' (it basically is an emulator). It began as a stolen file that was worked on. 'Fredaikis AB' is a non-professional amateur group of persons that simply wants money. In-game assets, news, and even activities done by the developers are offensive and simply should not have the privilege of being on Steam. The owner of the game has created cheats in the past to destroy the competition, that is not fair at all.   Pros:  - Gameplay itself is fun, yet it feels clunky.  - The loot in the game is amazing, it provides a sense of reward.  - Skin and crate system implementation.  Cons: - Non-professional skins (badly executed and designed). - The user interface is very bad. - Irregular development process and development.  - Bad AI. - The cycle is repetitive and there is nothing to do on the world. - The atmosphere feels cheap and non-professional.  - Non-original items.   Note: I have been a veteran player. I've seen what they have done (things such as banning players with no reason, emptying global inventories, etc.) and it is a mess.   Score: 3/10
